Development of Student Accommodation at 72 Eyre Place

Information and community input from the Eyre Place Residents Special Interest Group

Welcome!

You may have heard that there has been a planning application notice posted for the use of the former Jewson's builders yard as a site of purpose-built student accommodation. We are running a quick survey to gather the views of the local community around Eyre Place, Eyre Place Lane, Rodney Street and Rodney Place. If you are a resident, owner or frequent visitor to the area, we would really appreciate your views:

Link to residents survey.

We know that contributing to planning consultations can take a great deal of individual effort. Over the coming weeks, we plan to add resources to this page to make the process as easy as possible. We've included a contact form at the bottom, where you can sign up to receive updates at key stages in the process.

Key stages of the consultation process:

  • 22 Dec 2021: Developer (CASL) submitted ‘Pre-Application Notice’(PAN) to Council. (This must be done 12 weeks before any detailed Planning Application is submitted, and the developer must consult local community views during this time.)
  • 14th Feb 2022: Proposed development to be discussed on New Town and Broughton Community Council Agenda
  • 15th Feb 2022 - 9th March 2022: 'Virtual consultation' period opens for providing input to the developer online. This is separate to the formal planning consultation run by the council.
  • 23rd Feb 2022 (3pm - 7pm): 'Virtual feedback event' for online discussion of individuals in the community with the developer.
  • 16th March onwards: Developer can submit their detailed plans (i.e. full application) for the site from this date onwards. Public has 21 days after detailed plan submission to make comments on the plans.
  • 6th April 2022: Earliest deadline for public comments or objections to the Developer's plans.

Contact us

If you are a local resident of Eyre Place, Eyre Place Lane, Rodney Street or the surrounding area, you are welcome to join our Special Interest Group. We currently have a 'MeWe' social network site and Whatsapp group for sharing draft documents and updates. Please provide your email address and/or mobile phone number below and we will get back to you.

For any press, media or local council enquiries, please also provide your details below.

How can we help?

"We need to see the tide starting to turn back and more properties – particularly in the City Centre that we want to remain a vibrant place – continue to be first and foremost for residents."

Adam McVey, Edinburgh Council Leader, Edinburgh Reporter January 2022
